intro: Lepidium jaredii subsp. album, commonly known as the white cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and slender, branching stems. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in wet meadows. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
